Johann Sebastian Bach

Sonata no. 6 in G major, BWV 1019

c. 1739–1740

[Wikipedia] · [IMSLP]

Total duration: 4' 30"

  • 3. Allegro

The sonata, in five movements for violin and harpsichord, has a third movement for solo harpsichord.

The sonata also exists in two earlier versions (BWV1,2,2a 1019a; BWV3 1019.1 and 1019.2); the first of these has as its third movement the courante from the sixth partita (BWV 830/3) and as its fifth movement a variant of the Tempo di Gavotta from the same partita (BWV 830/6).

Recommended editions

  • Neue Bach-Ausgabe (Bärenreiter) · VI, 1 · BA 5012-01 · Werke für Violine · ed. Rudolf Gerber / Günter Haußwald

3. Allegro

Duration: 4' 30"

Difficulty: 2.5
